text.section:
A pilot is eligible for payments as an inactive pilot under § 11-505 of this subtitle if the pilot:
chooses to be placed on the list of inactive pilots maintained by the Association; and
has been, for at least 25 years:
a member in good standing of the Association; and
licensed by the Board to provide pilotage for vessels of unlimited draft; or
has been certified by two physicians chosen by the Board to be permanently incapable of providing pilotage; or
has had a federal or State pilot's license revoked for physical disability; and
before becoming permanently disabled, the pilot was:
a member in good standing of the Association; and
licensed by the Board to provide pilotage for vessels of any draft.

A pilot is eligible for reduced payments as an inactive pilot under § 11-505 of this subtitle if the pilot:
chooses to be placed on the list of inactive pilots maintained by the Association; and
has been, for at least 20 years:
a member in good standing of the Association; and
licensed by the Board to provide pilotage for vessels of unlimited draft.

Eligibility for payments as an inactive pilot shall cease if:
a pilot who was declared permanently incapable of providing pilotage becomes capable of providing pilotage; or
a pilot who had a federal or State pilot's license revoked for physical disability has the license reissued.
Time of service as a licensed docking master on or before September 30, 2004, shall be included in determining a pilot's eligibility for payment as an inactive pilot.

A pilot who held an unlimited docking master license on October 1, 2000, is eligible for reduced payments as an inactive pilot under § 11-505 of this subtitle if the pilot:
chooses to be placed on the list of inactive pilots maintained by the Association; and
has been, for at least 5 years:
a member in good standing of the Association or of the Association of Maryland Docking Pilots; and
licensed by the Board to provide pilotage for vessels of unlimited draft.
